data.title: What Is The Structure of The Poem
data.meta_description: What is the structure of the poem - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The poem "The Waste Land" by T.S. Eliot explores the theme of cultural and spiritual decay in the modern world after World War I. It uses a fragmented style with allusions to past works and a tone of resignation and despair. The structure divides the long poem into five parts with surreal vignettes in vague scenes commenting on post-war society. Eliot breaks from traditional forms which he saw as exhausted, creating a chaotic work through cultural echoes and fragments of hope.
data.text: What Is The Structure of The Poem
